New Records: San Diego Padres scored 10 runs, the most in the series so far.
Los Angeles Dodgers scored 2 runs, their lowest in the NLDS this season.
Key Match Events: San Diego Padres hit six home runs, tying a franchise record.
Game paused in the 7th inning due to fan interference, delaying play.
Padres' Jackson Merrill hit two key RBI singles and a home run.
Los Angeles Dodgers' Max Muncy hit a solo home run in the 9th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: San Diego Padres entered the game aiming to avoid elimination.
Los Angeles Dodgers had a 1-4 record at Petco Park in the 2024 regular season.
Post-Match Reflections: San Diego Padres' team hitting was highlighted as a key factor.
Yu Darvish's strong performance was noted, especially against the Dodgers.
Los Angeles Dodgers struggled with starter Jack Flaherty's effectiveness.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the second meeting in the NLDS, tying the series 1-1.
San Diego Padres' bottom of the lineup contributed significantly with four home runs.
Others: The Dodgers' top lineup performers, including Shohei Ohtani and Mookie Betts, struggled.
Game summary highlighted the Padres' dominance in the middle innings.
